The claim was based on an exit poll cond: 2. The exit poll showed that Walker received 48 percent of the vote among 18- to 24-year-olds, while his opponent, Mary Burke, received 49 percent.
The claim was later clarified by Walker: s campaign, stating that he misspoke and was actually referring to his performance in the 2012 recall election, where he won 51 percent of the 18- to 24-year-old vote.
The sample size for the 18: to 24-year-old segment in the 2014 exit poll was relatively small, with only 191 voters, which introduces a large margin of error and makes analysis of that portion of the poll difficult.
